messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RV'ing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/7/2003 1:36:12 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Nope. She MUST show up. Not for the speeding ticket, but for the reckless endangerment
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/7/2003 1:36:12 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
rubyprincesstsg@... writes:
> Yep, VA is very strict about that sort of thing, but luckily for her she can
>
> pre pay her ticket by mailing it in, just give the County a call where she
> got her ticket. Unless of course she wants to contest the ticket, that you
>
> have to do in person.

Nope. She MUST show up. Not for the "speeding" ticket, but for the "reckless
endangerment" ticket.

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RV'ing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/4/2003 7:19:32 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Yep, VA is very strict about that sort of thing, but luckily for her she can pre pay her
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/4/2003 7:19:32 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
kbcdlovejo@... writes:

> The cop took one look and gave her a summons to appear in
> court next month. Virginia doesn't look kindly on kids out of seat belts!
>
>

Yep, VA is very strict about that sort of thing, but luckily for her she can
pre pay her ticket by mailing it in, just give the County a call where she
got her ticket. Unless of course she wants to contest the ticket, that you
have to do in person.

glena


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RV'ing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/4/2003 6:24:20 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... My friend drove down from NY to SC this week. Her boys were asleep on a mattress on the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/4/2003 6:24:20 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Natrlmama@... writes:
> So if you have a sofa and chair, there will be seatbelts there. Our
> motorhome
> is a bit older so I don't know if newer ones have seatbelts in the dinette.
> I
> wish ours did. I allow the kids to sleep in the back bedroom. I believe
> all
> seatbelt laws apply whether you are in a RV or auto, so they should be
> belted in.

My friend drove down from NY to SC this week. Her boys were asleep on a
mattress on the floor. She was speeding and was stopped. She tried waking the
boys with no luck. The cop took one look and gave her a summons to appear in
court next month. Virginia doesn't look kindly on kids out of seat belts!

~Kelly
